channel.title: The Health Code Daily
channel.description: The Health Code Daily is your reminder to take time for yourself, keep happy and stay focused. We crack the code on all things health, fitness and lifestyle, sharing simple tips on motivation, staying active and being thoughtful throughout your day.

item.title: Ep. 52: Training Around Your Cycle
item.description: Today is a very exciting and insightful episode for the girls: how do you train around your cycle? Although we are taught to find a consistent workout routine and stick to it every week, Dee is telling us why that's actually not the best way to train for women. Our bodies are sensitive to what time of the month it is. There are weeks where you can - and should - go all out with cardio and heavy lifting, while there's also a period of time when you need to slow down, recover and give your body some rest through long walks and stretching. item.title: Ep. 37: Intermittent Fasting For Women
item.description: Intermittent Fasting (IF) definitely had its time of day and we can confidentially say everyone we know has given it a try, whether it's for weight loss, acne, gut health or lifestyle changes. However, Dee is tackling the controversial topic: is it actually good for women? Women's bodies change monthly with the cycle, which affects our energy, blood-sugar and stress level. Adding in deprivation of food according to the chosen fasting window can add on to an already elevated stress level - which can actually be counterproductive to what we're trying to achieve. So if you're trying to figure out if IF is suitable for you, listen up. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices
